article.name: Whitelisting Notifications from KCM GRC
article.title: Whitelisting Notifications from KCM GRC
article.body:
If you use the KCM Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) platform, you will receive various types of email notifications from the console. If you're experiencing deliverability issues with your KCM GRC platform or policy campaign notifications, whitelist either the IP addresses or the hostnames shown below.

Important: Be careful not to over-whitelist. Depending on your environment, add the following IP addresses or hostname to your spam filter or mail server: 

IP Addresses

 Messages Sent

147.160.167.0/26 *

23.21.109.197

23.21.109.212

All notifications from KCM GRC, including: account confirmation, password reset, task reminder, task approval reminder, questionnaire assignment, questionnaire issue created, questionnaire issue response, and policy acknowledgment notifications. 

* Please note that "/26" is the CIDR format for an IP subnet mask. In this case, it indicates the following IP range: 147.160.167.0 - 147.160.167.63. For more information on IP network subnets, please see here.

Hostname

Messages Sent

psm.knowbe4.com

All notifications from KCM GRC, including: account confirmation, password reset, task reminder, task approval reminder, questionnaire assignment, questionnaire issue created, questionnaire issue response, and policy acknowledgment notifications. 

Still having issues with email notifications? Please contact our Support team. 

Important: Before adding end users to your policy management module, each of the email address domains held by your employees must be added to the Domain Whitelist under your Account Settings. Please contact our Support team with a request to add your domains (note: you may be asked to provide proof of ownership).
